title: BBC Local Live: Essex - BBC News
summary: baroness chakrabarti to step down as university of essex chancellor .

documents.title: colchester united 0-0 newport county
text: colchester united 0-0 newport county

documents.title: that 's all from essex live
text: our live coverage for the week has now come to an end .
here 's what we 've covered on essex live today :
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 with more stories from across the county .
have a great weekend .

documents.title: security guards baby-sit giant pumpkin
text: ipswich-based seed firm thompson & morgan has hired security guards to keep an eye on a giant pumpkin overnight .
it is hoped the vegetable , which has been grown by hyde hall at south woodham ferrers in essex from a seed bought for over £ 1,200 by thompson & morgan , will set a new size record .
it 's due to be weighed in southampton on saturday

documents.title: weather : rather cloudy , but staying mostly dry
text: there 'll be little change from earlier through this evening and overnight , with often cloudy skies and the odd shower possible .
whilst the moderate easterly breeze will gradually ease , it will remain chilly with a minimum temperature of 11c ( 52f ) .
the cloudy skies could potentially bring a few further showers through tomorrow .
some brighter or sunny spells are likely as it peaks at 16c ( 61f ) .
get your local forecast from bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: today has been a dark day for essex
text: feel like there have been dark clouds above your head all day today ?
do n't worry - it 's been like that everywhere in essex it seems
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: basildon man arrested in £ 2m tobacco smuggling investigation
text: a 22-year-old man from basildon has been arrested during raids as part of an investigation into a suspected £ 2m tobacco smuggling fraud .
hm revenue and customs says officers seized more than seven million suspected illicit cigarettes in norfolk earlier this week .
a dagenham man was also detained .
both men have since been released on police bail .

documents.title: breakingboy , 15 , rebailed in polish harlow murder case
text: a teenager arrested in connection with the death of a polish man who was killed with a single punch in harlow has been rebailed .
the 15-year-old boy from harlow was detained after arek jozwik , 39 , died in the stow in august .
he will now return to a police station on 31 october .
five other teenagers were released without charge yesterday .

documents.title: chairs at bus stop 'nothing to do with us ' , says council
text: sadly , padded velour chairs at bus stops wo n't be rolled out across the borough of southend as the town 's council has just confirmed to me that the four below had nothing to do with them .
the mystery continues .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: is this the poshest bus stop in essex ?
text: we 're not sure who did it or why they did it - but this bus stop in station road , westcliff-on-sea , certainly makes a change from the cold metal benches you usually have to sit on .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clown pranksters need to be 'more considerate '
text: essex police 's press office has said it does `` not have capacity to provide details of every incident which has been linked to this craze or involved clowns this week .
please accept this as our only statement on clown incidents at this time '' .
acting ch insp darren deex said : `` essex police is aware of a number of reports from concerned residents relating to people dressed as clowns , specifically near to schools during opening times .
`` it would appear the intentions of these 'clowns ' is to scare members of the public .
`` there has been huge public interest in these photographs and videos , particularly on social media networking sites which more often than not do not represent accurate reporting .
`` this inaccurate reporting is further fuelling the 'craze ' and creating a perception of fear in the community .

`` we would also like to warn people who are thinking of being actively involved in this 'craze ' that in doing so they may commit offences under the public order act 1986 and to be more considerate of the feelings of others , especially young children and the elderly . ''

documents.title: braintree sign ex-canaries defender
text: braintree sign ex-canaries defender

documents.title: clown sightings in the uk
text: so what is this new clown craze that is sweeping the nation and now essex ?

documents.title: police warning as 'clown craze ' spreads to essex
text: people dressing up as clowns and scaring the public has become popular on twitter in the usa .
- now it has spread to essex .
but essex police is warning anybody who is thinking of taking part that they could be committing an offence under the public order act 1986 .
acting ch insp darren deex said the force was aware of a `` number of reports '' of incidents in the county , however to date there have been no reports of physical threats , harm or violence .

documents.title: colchester sign free agent doyley
text: colchester sign free agent doyley

documents.title: weather : cloudy with the chance of showers
text: this afternoon will be rather cloudy with a few showers around .
there will also be a few brighter and sunny spells possible , however it will stay rather cool in the easterly breeze with a maximum temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
popping out ?
get the latest forecast from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: one-punch killer cleared of manslaughter
text: one-punch killer cleared of manslaughter

documents.title: baroness chakrabarti to stand down as university of essex chancellor
text: baroness chakrabarti is to step down as university of essex chancellor at the end of the academic year , it has been announced .
the labour peer sparked controversy last month when she said `` do n't leave me locked in a room with essex man '' at a party conference event .
baroness chakrabarti has since been appointed as shadow attorney general as part of jeremy corbyn 's shadow cabinet .
in a statement , the university thanked her for her work , adding : `` following her confirmation as shadow attorney general , baroness chakrabarti has offered to stand down as chancellor . ''

documents.title: breakingbaroness chakrabarti to step down as university of essex chancellor
text: baroness chakrabarti is to step down as chancellor of the university of essex at the end of the academic year .
more to follow

documents.title: benfleet boy arrested after west ham v middlesbrough violence
text: a 17-year-old boy from benfleet has been arrested following trouble after west ham united 's premier league match against middlesbrough last weekend .
the teenager is being questioned on sus of violent disorder and possessing an offensive weapon .
he is currently being held at an east london police station after being detained at his home earlier today .

documents.title: bradley casey 'wept ' as he was cleared of manslaughter
text: bradley casey wept as he was cleared of manslaughter at chelmsford crown court this morning .
the 21-year-old had always claimed he acted in self defence to having a cigarette forced into his mouth at the christmas party on 12 december .
dressed in a grey suit , white shirt and blue tie mr casey trembled as the jury foreman announced `` not guilty '' .

documents.title: jury takes 30 minutes to clear one-punch killer
text: a 21-year-old man who killed a work colleague with a single punch to the jaw at a christmas work party last year has been found not guilty of manslaughter , after he successfully argued it was an act of self defence .
william wareham , 53 , died from a single punch to the jaw at a bupa healthcare christmas party at the park inn hotel in harlow last year .
it took the jury just 30 minutes to clear bradley casey of castle street , thetford , norfolk following a four-day trial at chelmsford crown court .

documents.title: breakingone-punch killer cleared of christmas party manslaughter
text: a 21-year-old man from norfolk has been found not guilty of manslaughter after he killed a colleague with a single punch at a work 's christmas party in harlow .
more details on this shortly .

documents.title: broomfield hospital warns of long a & e waits due to 'unprecedented ' demand
text: `` unprecedented numbers of very sick patients '' are attending a & e at broomfield hospital in chelmsford at the moment , the trust says .
it 's warning that people will be waiting longer than normal today and over the weekend due to increase in demand across the county .

documents.title: record-breaking pumpkin ready for weigh in
text: a gardener is poised to learn whether the pumpkin grown from the world 's most expensive pumpkin seed is itself a record-breaker

matthew oliver from hyde hall near south woodham ferrers has been growing the seed which came from a 2,323lbs ( 1,054kg ) pumpkin and was bought by ipswich-based seed company thompson & morgan earlier this year for £ 1,250 .
we 'll have to wait until tomorrow to find out if mr oliver 's gourd is a winner , but here 's what happened when we met him back in may :

documents.title: essex police constable sacked over computer misuse
text: an essex police constable has been sacked without notice for gross misconduct .
an independent panel found that , between july 2009 and october 2011 , det con darren paterson intentionally accessed the force 's computers to view confidential information .
the two day hearing , which concluded yesterday , also heard paterson failed to disclose true and complete details on vetting forms .

documents.title: world record pumpkin seed bears fruit
text: world record pumpkin seed bears fruit

documents.title: man left with fractured eye socket after 'nasty ' colchester bar fight
text: a man has been left with a fractured eye socket after a fight involving 10 people at a bar in colchester , police say .
the 20-year-old victim was attacked by a group of men following an argument in hudson bar & grill at about midnight on 10 september .
officers say the attack was `` nasty '' and the man was also left with a broken ankle .

documents.title: thurrock one of the top destinations for londoners
text: thurrock is the third most popular destination for people moving from london , new figures have revealed .
the latest internal migration statistics show more than 4,700 left the capital for the south essex borough last year .
epping forest was also popular with those exiting london , with 4,570 residents choosing a new life there .

documents.title: fallen tree blocks c2c line between grays and upminster
text: buses are replacing train services on the c2c line between grays and upminster due to a fallen tree .
trains are unable to run on any of the lines between these stations at the moment .
c2c says journey times are currently extended by about 10 minutes .

documents.title: greater anglia first class 'a wreck ' , says businessman
text: if you 're reading this on your commute to work , what sort of state is the seat you 're sitting on in ?
one essex man is n't happy with greater anglia after treating himself to a first class ticket on wednesday , but was greeted with what he describes as a `` wreck '' .
geoff burling paid £ 67 for the journey from london liverpool street to audley end , and was less than impressed with what he found .
`` the seats were falling apart and filthy .
it was n't suitable for second class , let alone first , '' he said .
abellio greater anglia says the seat was in that state because it had been vandalised , and is bringing in more than a thousand new seats .

documents.title: ukip donor arron banks to stop funding party unless douglas carswell leaves
text: ukip 's main financial donor arron banks ( left ) has said he will stop funding the party unless clacton mp douglas carswell ( right ) leaves .
the man with the money launched the fierce assault after months of infighting between the party on their only mp .
the announcement from the millionaire businessman comes a day after ukip 's leadership favourite steven woolfe was hospitalised following a reported fight at a meeting of the party 's meps .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: weather : cloudier than recent days but mostly dry
text: today will be cloudy and some places will remain dry with bright spells , but there are a few showers around .
it will stay rather cool in the easterly breeze with a maximum temperature of 15c ( 59f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
more details at bbc weather .
author: Aisling Creevey
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to essex live
text: hello and welcome back to essex live .
join us throughout the day for stories around the county as they happen .
if you 've got something you want to get off your chest you can always send us an email , a tweet or go to our facebook page .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular updates for essex live have now finished , but check back throughout the evening for any breaking news .
before we go , here are the top stories we 've covered today :
the team will be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 with another look at what 's happening in the county .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: call for more research into causes of young people 's infertility
text: a leading fertility researcher is concerned that many causes of infertility among younger couples may be missed by gps who have no detailed knowledge and are denying them treatment .
family doctors can not be specialists as reproductive medicine is still a relatively young field , dr arpita ray , lead clinician at bourn hall 's colchester clinic , said .

`` common reasons for infertility such as blocked fallopian tubes or low sperm count wo n't be improved by waiting , so it is important that these conditions are addressed to maximise the chance of conception , '' he said .
`` we are concerned by the initial findings of a research project and want more people to complete a survey so that it is more representative . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : chance of a shower tonight and tomorrow
text: tonight will be mainly dry with bright or sunny spells with the chance of a light , isolated shower , with a low of 8c ( 46f ) .
tomorrow will be a day of sunny spells and variable amounts of cloud and the chance of a shower , especially the further east you are .
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: 'season of mists and mellow fruitfulness ' , john keats and weather watchers
text: it 's national poetry day and our weather watchers have joined the bard john keats to celebrate the `` season of mists and mellow fruitfulness '' from his ode to autumn , with from around the county .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: poppy display to honour those that fell in world war one coming to southend
text: a display of poppies , previously on show at the tower of london to honour each uk and colonial death of world war one , is to come to shoeburyness near southend next year .
the poppy display , entitled wave was created by artist paul cummins and designer tom piper , will be at gunners park in april , may and june .
southend was the victim of one of the first air raids on the uk and many of the artillery guns used in the war were designed and tested at shoeburyness .
john lamb , leader of southend-on-sea borough council , said : `` i 'm thrilled that the iconic poppies will be exhibited at barge pier .
`` the ranges and garrison played a key role in both world wars , so it is apt that they should host this spectacular work of art . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: football : nile ranger to return to blues after recovering from injury
text: southend united striker nile ranger is in contention to feature in the blues ' league one match against rochdale on saturday after recovering from injury .
nile ranger will be a big player for us # southend # essexfooty @ twitterid

documents.title: young couples seeking ivf treatment face 'barrier of youth '
text: two organisations in essex are helping a leading fertility clinic to overcome a commonly- held attitude that young people can not be infertile .
a survey by bourn hall , a leading ivf clinic , has discovered that some young couples are failing to get fertility treatment .
it is now working with healthwatch essex and healthwatch havering to open up discussion on the causes of infertility among younger people .

couples seeking help are frequently told they are `` too young to have a problem and should try for longer '' , but there may be underlying causes of infertility , dr arpita ray , lead clinician at bourn hall 's colchester clinic , said .
`` it is well known that fertility declines with age but there are many other causes , '' he said .
he wants further studies of infertility affecting younger people in essex .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: courtney wood aims to be business partner of lord sugar
text: the apprentice starts tonight and one of the contestants who wants to be a business partner of lord sugar is courtney wood from essex .
one of three essex @ twitterid contestants @ twitterid hoping to impress the boss @ twitterid

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: here are our top stories from essex live today :
author: BBC Essex

documents.title: national poetry day : the a12 - ruts and all
text: everybody has a road , according to performance poet luke wright , and his is the a12 - ruts and all .
the poem , a12 , is one of 40 created by poets across england for the # bbclocalpoets project as part of national poetry day .
wright , who studied at the norwich-based university of east anglia , was inspired by the many hours he spends driving along the route from his home in suffolk to essex where he was brought up .
you can see more of the poems inspired by the east of england on the bbc look east facebook page .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: weather : sunshine breaking through
text: cloud will break up this afternoon allowing more sunshine to break through like our weather watchers from shantelle at clacton-on-sea .
however , it will stay rather breezy , bringing a slightly cooler feel than yesterday .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f )
more details from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: one teenager still on police bail over death of polish man in harlow
text: one 15-year-old from harlow remains on police bail after five others have been released with no further action by police investigating the death of arkadiusz jozwik , known as arek , near takeaway shops in the stow on 27 august .
six teenagers , five aged 15 and one aged 16 , all from harlow , were arrested on sus of murder .
det insp danny stoten said : `` the investigation into arek jozwik 's death is progressing and i am grateful to the harlow community for their on-going support .
`` arek 's family has been updated throughout the investigation .
`` so far we have taken over 150 witness statements , spoken to over 300 people during house-to-house and general inquiries and seized over 100 hours of cctv .
`` in excess of 30 police officers and staff have been involved in the investigation . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: breakinginvestigation continues into harlow death as teenagers released without charge
text: five teenagers who were arrested and questioned over the killing of a polish man in harlow , have been released from bail with no further action due to insufficient evidence , essex police said .
officers said they would continue the investigation into the death of arkadiusz jozwik , known as arek , in harlow .
mr jozwik , 40 , was assaulted at about 23:35 on 27 august outside the tgf pizza and mr luigi 's takeaway shops in the stow .
after receiving a single blow to the head and falling to the ground he suffered head injuries and was taken to the princess alexandra hospital .
he was later transferred to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge , where he died on monday evening 29 august .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: breakingharlow death teenage suspects 'released with no further action '
text: five teenagers have been released from police bail with no further action to be taken against them as essex police continues the investigation into the death of arkadiusz jozwik , known as arek , in harlow on 27 august .
more to follow

documents.title: couples denied ivf treatment as 'too young to be infertile '
text: a new survey has revealed that some couples are n't getting the help they need because they are considered too young to be infertile and bbc essex 's new mid-morning presenter ronnie barbour talks to those affected .
rachel hinsbey from # chelmsford tells @ twitterid it 's difficult for fertility problems to be taken seriously when you 're young .

documents.title: rail line blocked after lorry hits bridge at hockley
text: train services between wickford and southend victoria are cancelled , delayed or suspended due to a lorry hitting a railway bridge at hockley .
disruption includes services to london liverpool street and is expected to last into the afternoon as engineers inspect the bridge for damage .
an alternative route is available on c2c rail services between southend central and fenchurch street .
abellio greater anglia said its tickets would be valid on c2c services .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: 'inadequate ' gp practice lacked systems for management of medicines
text: a medical practice in grays has been censured by an nhs watchdog that discovered no systems in place in some areas of medicine management .

patients at the balfour medical practice , run by dr anil bansal , who were prescribed high-risk medicines or those requiring regular monitoring were not being monitored , according to a care quality commission report .
blank prescription forms and pads were not securely stored and there were no systems in place to monitor their use .
the practice , which had been described overall as `` inadequate '' by the commission after an inspection in may , also had high rates of anti-bacterial prescribing .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: girls approached by 'creepy clowns '
text: here is the front page of the essex edition today 's east anglian daily times :
author: East Anglian Daily Times

documents.title: weather : bright start to the day
text: it 's expected to turn cloudier and cooler today , but this bbc weather watcher has sent a sunny .
from the stour valley on the border of essex and suffolk this morning :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: family rescued after left-over meal catches fire in oven
text: a colchester couple and their two young children , both aged under five , have been rescued after a fire in their kitchen .
it happened in highwoods yesterday evening .
station officer craig todd said : `` the family had cooked a roast dinner the day before and had left a pan containing oil in the oven .
`` the appliance was switched on again this evening and the oil caught alight , causing a fire with plenty of smoke . ''
author: BBC Essex

documents.title: investment into trains
text: plans for new trains on the greater anglia main line through norfolk , suffolk and essex have moved a step closer .
the european investment bank has agreed a £ 60m loan to the operator abellio , to try to improve passenger services on the key route into london and other local services .
the 378 new train carriages will replace the outdated electric and diesel trains currently in use .
in august , the .
company won a nine-year franchise , promising a £ 1.4bn investment programme .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lines closed between marks tey and sudbury
text: abellio greater anglia advises that the lines between marks tey and sudbury are closed , due to a fault with the train driver to signal box radio system .
disruption is expected until 10:00 .

documents.title: weather : dry and cloudy
text: a cooler and cloudier day than yesterday .
it 'll stay dry with some sunny intervals .
temperatures reaching 15c ( 59f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
weather has more details for wherever you live .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: gp surgery in grays put into special measures by health watchdog
text: morning !
welcome to today 's essex live page .
a gp surgery in grays has been put into special measures by the health watchdog .
action has been taken against the balfour medical practice which is run by dr anil bansal after an inspection in may found the quality of care was `` inadequate '' .

a key finding was that `` appropriate recruitment checks on staff had not been undertaken prior to their employment and actions identified to address concerns with infection control practice had not been taken '' .
the care quality commission says a further inspection will be taking place in six months time .
we 'll bring you more details as well as the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from now right through until 18:00 this evening .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: widow to sue over 'missed heart attack '
text: widow to sue over 'missed heart attack '
author: Claire Ellison
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular updates for essex live have now finished , but check back throughout the evening for any breaking news .
before we go , here are the top stories we 've covered today :
the team will be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 with another look at what 's happening in the county .

documents.title: christmas party death accused 'panicked '
text: christmas party death accused 'panicked '

documents.title: overnight weather : dry but becoming quite chilly
text: it 'll become rather breezy , and turn increasingly cloudy during the evening and overnight , with lows of between 6c and 12c ( 43f to 54f ) .
thursday will be cloudier , and mainly dry although there 's the risk of a few showers in places .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can get a more detailed forecast , wherever you live , from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: one-punch killer 'just panicked ' , court hears
text: a man who killed his colleague with a single punch to the jaw at a work christmas party where both had been taking cocaine `` just panicked '' , a court has heard .

bradley casey , 21 , of thetford , norfolk , hit project manager william wareham , 53 , following an argument over taxis outside the park inn hotel in harlow , essex , chelmsford crown court was told .
mr casey said there had been a good atmosphere at the bupa party until a group decided to get a taxi into town to continue drinking at around midnight on 12 december last year .
he said trouble flared when the taxi he ordered had not arrived , and mr wareham called him `` useless '' .
`` he got a cigarette , jabbed it in my mouth , '' said casey .
`` i felt threatened .
i just panicked and hit him . ''
mr casey said he had ash in his mouth following the incident but no burns from the stub .
he denies a single count of manslaughter , claiming he was acting in self-defence .
the case is continuing .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: pupils kept in school as a 'precaution ' after clown incident
text: pupils at clacton county high school were kept on site today as a `` precaution '' after two people dressed as clowns approached pupils on their way to school this morning .
essex police tells us it is investigating the incident and appealing for anybody who may have saw what happened to come forward .

documents.title: dogs from illegal puppy farm made to 'look like they 'd come from loving homes '
text: the rspca says hundreds of puppies bred on an illegal puppy farm were `` made to look like they 'd come from loving homes '' .
today , four people pleaded guilty to fraud after a travellers ' site in aveley was found to be used for the breeding and selling of dogs , many of which suffered serious health problems or died .

rspca inspector carroll lamport said : `` this is a tactic that more and more of these people are using to trick the public and to avoid raising any sus and it 's something we are seeing increasingly in these cases . ''

documents.title: clacton schoolgirls approached by 'clowns '
text: two girls have been approached by two people dressed as clowns as they walked to school in clacton and asked whether they `` wanted to attend a birthday party '' , police say .
it happened in oxford road this morning as the pupils made their way to clacton county high school .
no attempts were attempted to grab the girls and the `` clowns '' made off in a van .
officers are considering whether the incident could be inspired by similar cases in the united states

documents.title: puppy fraud worth more than £ 300,000
text: the rspca , which raided the site in aveley and found dozens of `` cockerpoo '' puppies kept in cages inside dark sheds , estimates that the fraud was worth more than £ 300,000 .
the gang admitted at basildon crown court each puppy was sold for an average of £ 450 .
the dogs - some barely two weeks old - had soiled newspapers for bedding , no toys and some had no heating .

documents.title: man arrested after two teenagers taken ill after taking s
text: last week we told you told two teenagers had been taken to hospital in colchester after having a serious reaction to the former legal high s
today , police have announced a 40-year-old man has a been arrested on sus of supplying a psychoactive substance .
the man has been released on police bail until january .

documents.title: £ 300k puppy fraud gang convicted
text: £ 300k puppy fraud gang convicted

documents.title: new £ 1.5bn rolling stock order confirmed
text: commuters in the east can expect to travel on new trains as part of the abellio franchise from spring 2019 .

abellio uk , which was awarded a new nine-year east anglia rail franchise by the department for transport in august , says it has finalised contracts worth nearly £ 1.5bn to procure and finance the replacement of all existing trains on its routes .
the company says its fleet will increase by 10 % .
all the new rolling stock will be in use by autumn 2020 .
two-thirds of the 1,043 carriages will be built in derby , and the rest in switzerland .

dominic booth , managing director of abellio uk , said : `` they will be the centrepiece of many other improvements , including more frequent services , faster journeys and more capacity with 55 % more seats into london in the morning peak . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: about 750 puppies handled by fraudsters
text: four people have admitted fraud over the sale of hundreds of puppies at a farm in essex .
the gang , from essex and east london , admitted that between july 2013 and october 2014 they handled around 750 puppies , some of which died or suffered serious health problems .

teresa wade , 57 , of ship lane , aveley , ; victoria montgomery , 54 , of melford avenue , dagenham ; and roxanne montgomery , 54 , and tony hammond , 54 , both of grafton road , dagenham , pleaded guilty to the offence at basildon crown court today .

documents.title: breakingfour plead guilty to fraud over puppy sale trial
text: three women and a man have pleaded guilty to fraud over the sale of hundreds of puppies in essex , some of which died or suffered serious health problems .
more on this shortly .

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: here are our top stories from essex live today :
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : dry and bright but windy
text: the afternoon will be dry with plenty of sunshine but feeling breezy , particularly along the coast .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
popping out ?
get your local forecast via bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man charged after pensioner is killed by double-decker bus
text: a man has been charged with causing death by careless driving after an elderly man was hit by a double- decker bus in tilbury , police have said .
the collision happened in civic square in august .
an 82-year-old local man was killed .
a 49-year-old man from rochester , kent , has been released on police bail and is due in court in november .

documents.title: sausage-maker 's view on jamie oliver 's chorizo paella
text: as the jamie oliver paella chorizo row continues , bbc essex has asked a harlow sausage-maker his thought on the whole saga .
jason drage said he could see why it had caused some upset as some people did n't want recipes to be `` messed around with '' .
but he added : `` however , there are also any many people who want to experiment . ''

documents.title: southend pier train back open to the public from midday
text: good news if you 're planning on visiting the world 's longest pleasure pier .
after 12 weeks out of action , the train , which runs the length of the southend landmark , will be back in service to members of the public from lunchtime .
the train was stopped back in june after cracks appeared in the pier 's structure .
today , the train will be running at a reduced speed and capacity .
great news for fans of # southend pier .
from midday we will start running a limited train service .
plan your trip at
plz spread the word @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
thanks for the # rt .
so pleased to see the old boy back on his feet ( well wheels ) after a longer-than-hoped-for hiatus .
another reason to visit salt cafe by @ twitterid on the end of the pier .
only took 6 months !
ruined our trip on the waverley last week .
nothing in place for disabled and elderly .
shocking .
hi sorry you had bad experience .
work took just over 3 months , not 6 .
we had some buggies in place for ppl with severe mobility
pleased to know that the trains are running on pier again
so are we .
it took longer than we 'd hoped but glad to warm up the old motor again !
what does the limited service mean ?
hi @ twitterid the pier train will be running at a reduced speed and slightly reduced capacity to start with .
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 5th for oct 5 . )

documents.title: southend united through to checkatrade knock-outs
text: meanwhile , southend fared better in the same competition as they secured their place in the final 32 with a win over leyton orient .
marc antoine fortune got the only goal in the blues ' 1-0 victory .
after the game assistant manager graham coughlan said : `` hopefully we 'll build a bit of momentum here now at roots hall as this is possible the best squad i 've seen at this place . ''
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: mcgreal blames set-pieces for colchester 's trophy exit
text: colchester united have exited their second cup competition of the season .
a 2-1 home defeat to southampton 's academy side last night means they ca n't qualify for the last 32 of the checkatrade trophy , with one group game to do .
head coach john mcgreal is annoyed with how they conceded the first goal , saying : `` we have n't conceded any set-pieces throughout the first 10 games , then we concede in the last two . ''
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: ukip 's douglas carswell 'surprised ' over diane james ' resignation
text: sam allardyce lasted longer as england manager than diane james did as leader of ukip .
after just 18 days in the post , ms james stepped down last night , claiming she did not have `` sufficient authority '' to see through changes she had planned .
the party 's only mp , clacton 's douglas carswell , said he was `` sad '' and `` surprised '' by her move and hoped she was all right .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: another nice start in essex
text: those dark mornings are made a little bit easier with sunrises like this , are n't they ?
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: jamie oliver 's chorizo paella causes a bit of a twitter stir
text: a lot of people are angry after jamie oliver tweeted a recipe that included chorizo in his version of a `` good spanish '' paella .
one user told the essex chef : `` this is an insult not only to our gastronomy but to our culture . ''
another wrote : `` remove the chorizo .
we do n't negotiate with terrorists .
first warning . ''
jamie has yet to respond to any of the complaints , but who knew a bit of sausage could cause so much upset !
good spanish food does n't get much better than paella .
my version combines chicken thighs & chorizo # recipeoftheday
blasphemy
no tiene mala pinta
esa no es espaňola
y porque en lugar de llamarlo paella no lo llamas de otra forma , por ejemplo : la mierda que hago con arroz y cosas
criteria should be always if it taste good !
i´m against anys `` fanatism '' .
the dish´s origen preparing paella with leftovers
this is an insult not only to our gastronomy but to our culture @ twitterid
please delete this and ask for our forgiveness on your knee while kissing my feet @ twitterid
you 've made our constitution cry over this @ twitterid
maybe if you had n't done this chenoa and bisbal would be together .
after this now that is impossible .
shame on you .
@ twitterid
maybe you should have heard better the brexit results as we do n't want you near us if all you do is this @ twitterid
i 'd rather eat my own shit than calling that paella you hear me ? ?
@ twitterid
he aquí mi fama
that does n't even look like a paella what the heck
paella valenciana
diez restaurantes donde comer las mejores paellas en valencia
tres clases hay de ignorancia : no saber lo que debiera saberse , saber mal lo que se sabe , y saber lo que no debiera saberse .
and this is our version of fish & chips , @ twitterid

documents.title: wednesday 's weather : dry with some sunny spells but feeling cooler
text: today will be dry with some sunshine , but feeling rather cool , especially near the coast .
top temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
it 'll remain dry overnight , and become chilly by dawn , with lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can get a more detailed forecast from bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: construction site remains closed after worker 's death
text: i 've come to the construction site in lawford , near manningtree , where a worker was killed on monday afternoon .
it 's believed the man , who was in his 30s and from clacton , died when a construction vehicle overturned at the summers park development .
i saw a police van leaving a short while ago - but the work has come to a halt here while the health and safety executive investigates what happened .
author: Richard Smith
BBC Essex

documents.title: police attend construction site where worker was killed
text: good morning and welcome back to essex live .
police have been at the scene of a building site in lawford , near manningtree , this morning after a construction worker was killed there on monday afternoon .
we 'll have the latest updates on this story , plus a look at other stories happening around the county .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: braintree town 1-2 boreham wood
text: braintree town 1-2 boreham wood

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live updates for essex have now come to an end - however check back throughout the night for any breaking news stories .
before we go , remember earlier we told you that tests were under way to get southend 's pier train back up and running ?
well , it look as if plans are on track as it was seen pulling into the station earlier today
the essex live team returns tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
have a great evening .
the train at southend pier is back up and running for testing .
it 's hoped passengers will be able to get back on it by the end of the week .

documents.title: weather : dry tonight and sunny tomorrow
text: there will be some sunny spells this evening , but it 's also turning a little cloudy in places .
staying dry overnight and remaining rather cloudy in eastern coastal areas , where temperatures will stay a little higher .
lows down to 9-14c ( 48-57f ) .
tomorrow , staying fine and dry with sunny spells but feeling cooler in an easterly breeze , with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: worker dies on lawford building site
text: a man in his 30s has died while working on a building site in lawford , police say .
the force , along with paramedics , were called to the summers park housing development at about 16:40 yesterday afternoon .
the man was pronounced dead at the scene .
developers tell us the site has been closed while the health and safety executive carries out an investigation .

documents.title: sir eric pickles : we all must make a concious effort to defy hate crime
text: brentwood and ongar mp sir eric pickles has told bbc essex race hate crime wo n't come down unless `` we all make a conscious effort to defy it '' .
the former communities secretary used a speech at the conservative party conference that anti-semitism is still a threat .
sir eric said : `` we need to see our neighbour not by the colour of their skin or religion , but as our neighbour .
we ca n't allow these men and women of hate to own our streets . ''

documents.title: man denies harlow christmas party manslaughter
text: the trial of a 21-year-old man accused of the manslaughter of a work colleague at a christmas party in harlow has started .

bradley casey of thetford , norfolk , but formerly of cheshunt , hertfordshire , hit william wareham , 53 , in the face , who then fell to the ground and struck his head on the pavement , chelmsford crown court heard .
mr casey claims he acted in self-defence at the park inn hotel on 12 december 2015 .
the trial is expected to last a week .

documents.title: 'multiple flights in short space of time ' blamed for increased stansted wait time
text: we 've just heard back from border force on the reportedly long delays through stansted airport 's passport control last night .
during the two hour period in question , all passengers in the european economic area queues were dealt with within our agreed 25 minute service standard .

on occasions , when multiple flights land at the same time , large amounts of passengers can arrive at the border in a short space of time , meaning a longer wait while essential security checks are conducted . ''

documents.title: stansted airport passport queue 'chaos '
text: there have been reports in the national media about long delays through passport control at stansted airport last night .
we 've spoken to one man who arrived back at the terminal to find what he describes as `` chaos '' .

documents.title: essex mum and son on school exclusion
text: earlier we told you about 10-year-old autistic boy joe salt from rochford , who has been excluded from school nine times .
it 's as figures uncovered by the bbc show essex had the third highest number of pupils expelled from the classroom last year .
well , joe and his mum zoe discussed the issue on the victoria derbyshire programme , and you can see how they got on below .
joe is currently in a specialist school , but his mum says he will be moving back to a mainstream school which will aid his academic progress .
author: Victoria Derbyshire

documents.title: epping visitors warned of 'aggressive deer ' as mating season begins
text: motorists , dog walkers and visitors to epping are being warned about aggressive deer as mating season begins in the district .
high testosterone levels mean males are more likely to fight off rivals as they try to attract as many females as possible .
councillor gary waller said : `` deer often move in groups , so if you see one , there are likely to be others following and they may leap out without warning . ''

documents.title: braintree sign defender elokobi on loan
text: braintree sign defender elokobi on loan

documents.title: the third warmest september on record
text: east anglia - september 2016 : - 3rd warmest september on record - sunshine slightly above average - rainfall slightly below average
this whole summer seems to have been very dry ( essex ) how are figures ?
above/below average ?
june was obviously a very wet month in many areas , but since then essex has been notably dry ( with local downpour exceptions ) :
thanks for that dan .
remarkable for being unremarkable .
consistently rather warm with a few warm/hot days .
nice month , but one folks will soon forget
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: colchester not 'doom and gloom ' over recent defeats
text: colchester united take on southampton 's academy side in the second match of the checkatrade trophy group stage .
the u 's were beaten in their opening match at crawley .
head coach john mcgreal tells us they ca n't be downbeat , despite a run of four games without a win .
`` we ca n't be doom and gloom .
it 's a fresh team out there and we 're creating opportunities to score , '' he said .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: southend united look for second win in checkatrade trophy
text: both essex sides are in action in the checkatrade trophy tonight .
southend united are looking to make it two wins out of two in the competition .
the blues host leyton orient at roots hall .
phil brown has told us he plans to make a few changes .
`` the games are coming thick and fast , so it 's likely everybody in the squad is going to get used , '' he said .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: weather : a fine and dry afternoon
text: staying largely dry and fine afternoon .
there will be some cloud around , and despite it being rather breezy at times , especially towards the coast , it should feel quite warm in any sun .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
popping out ?
get your latest forecast from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: here are our top stories from essex live so far :
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tests begin on southend pier train after 12 weeks out of action
text: after 12 weeks out of the action , southend pier 's train is back up and running for testing today .
the train , which runs the length of the 1.34 mile ( 2.16km ) landmark , has n't been operating after cracks were found in the wooden structure .
it 's hoped that if the test is successful , the service will be operating for the public by the end of this week .

documents.title: who wants you to vote ? # bbcunsunghero
text: we 've got just under three weeks to go now until the deadline for the bbc unsung hero award .
see which multi-medal-winning british athlete is urging you to get those nominations in now
to download or request a nomination form - and more details about the award - read here .

documents.title: school exclusion 'sad and lonely ' , says autistic boy
text: back to our exclusive story about the number of pupils excluded from school in essex and the impact it can have on the child .
joe salt , 10 , is from rochford and has autism .
he has been excluded nine times - the first time aged four-years-old and just two weeks into his education .
`` it was really sad and lonely , '' he said .
his mother zoe said he was excluded by his first mainstream school because `` they did not have the staff to cope with his behaviour , which was down to his autism '' .
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: your starlight over beaumont quay
text: thanks to matthew mallett for sending us this rather stunning image of the stars twinkling over beaumont quay , about 10 miles ( 15km ) east of colchester .
the essex coast blog writes the quay is `` made up of recycled pieces of london bridge '' and is an area of `` birds galore '' including curlews , brent geese and redshanks .
we love to see your of essex send them by email or to our facebook page .

documents.title: billericay woman 's sister calls for improved sepsis testing
text: a woman whose sister died from blood poisoning says there needs to be better awareness of the condition .

documents.title: man wanted after harlow liquid attack
text: police want to trace this man after two people had an unknown liquid thrown in their face in harlow last month .
it happened following what essex police are calling an `` altercation '' with three people at about 19:50 in tawneys road on 5 september .
the victims were left with soreness to their eyes .
edward connors , 29 from hertfordshire , is described as white , around 5ft 6in tall , of stocky build and with short brown hair .

documents.title: shock as 16-time world champion phil taylor is beaten by essex man steve west
text: essex dart player steve west caused huge upset at the world grand prix in dublin last night after he beat phil `` the power '' taylor 2-1 .
not even west ( left ) , who is from waltham abbey , would have predicted he 'd claim victory over the 16-time world champion .
speaking after the match the 41-year-old said he was `` gobsmacked '' .

documents.title: watch : 'snog , marry , avoid ? ' - james cleverly gets a reply from pm
text: a few months ago , braintree mp james cleverly said if he had to choose whether to snog , marry or avoid theresa may he 'd pucker up .
well , be careful what you wish for james , as the lady herself is waiting

documents.title: thurrock exclusions rise by 40 % in three years
text: thurrock has seen a 40 % rise in the number of children excluded from school in the past three years .
in total , 850 pupils were barred from classes in the past year compared with 610 in 2013 .
alison ryan of the association of teachers and lecturers said exclusions had significant consequences on pupils affected .
she said : `` if you are alienated at school you are more likely to end up not in employment or training and in the justice system at a later stage . ''

documents.title: firefighters tackle a12 recycling lorry fire
text: a recycling lorry is currently on fire on the northbound carriageway of the a12 .
essex fire and rescue service says it 's dealing with the blaze between j22 ( witham ) and j23 ( kelveden ) .
there are delays through the area .
latest travel information can be found at bbc travel .

documents.title: essex third highest in england for school exclusions
text: essex is the third highest county in england for school exclusions , new figures by the bbc have revealed .
in total , 6,560 kids were barred from classes last year , putting our county in the top three out of more than 160 authorities .
across england , there were 5,800 permanent exclusions in 2014-15 compared with 4,630 three years ago , government figures show .

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : dry with sunny spells
text: it 's going to be another day to enjoy being out and about , with the prospect of some fine , dry weather .
there 'll be some cloud around , but it should feel quite warm inland , with highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
this evening and overnight it should remain dry , with some clear spells .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
you can get a more detailed forecast from bbc weather .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning essex !
text: have you woken up feeling fresh and ready to take on tuesday ?
good - now standby for live coverage of the day 's news across essex .
coming up ; new figures show thurrock has seen a 40 % rise in the number of children excluded from school in the past three years .
more on that shortly .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: updates for essex live have now come to an end for the day - but check back throughout the night for any breaking news .
before we go , here are the top stories we 've covered today :
the team will be back for more live coverage from 08:00 tomorrow .
have a great evening .

documents.title: weather : a dry night - feeling warmer than of late
text: a dry evening and night with clear spells and some patchy mist and fog .
not as cold as last night .
temperatures down to 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow morning any mist and fog should quickly clear to leave a fine and dry day with spells of sunshine .
there 'll generally be more cloud around than today and the winds will be stronger too .
high of 18c ( 64f ) .
you 'll find your local forecast at bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: brexit debate : jenkin v grieve
text: looking at the uk 's future relations with the eu after theresa may said she would start the formal two-year process for leaving by march 2017 , daily politics presenter andrew neil heard reaction from two conservative mps .
bernard jenkin , mp for harwich and north essex , campaigned for brexit while dominic grieve backed remain and now supports the open britain campaign group .
author: The Daily Politics

documents.title: weather : dry tonight with sunny spells tomorrow
text: it will be a dry evening and night with clear spells and some patchy mist and fog .
not as cold as last night , with a low of 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow morning any mist and fog should quickly clear to leave a fine and dry day with spells of sunshine , and a high of 18c ( 64f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: throwback to churchill in shoebury
text: sir winston churchill boards his train at shoeburyness station after inspecting troops at shoebury garrison in 1941 .
in the words of winston ; never in the field of essex train travel has so much been ruined for so many , by so few .
# miseryline
thankfully you were n't running the line then or else he would have got nowhere : -d
is he still waiting for it to leave ?
comedy gold
technically it 's only `` winston churchill boards `` as he was n't knighted until 1953 .
it took bloody 8 years to knight the man that saved britain & europe from nazis yet a sportsman gets it within a year
is he still waiting for the train to arrive ?
bet you would n't have made him stand .
good ! .
he probably got from fs to shoebury quicker than on your time table and with a seat .
good thing you were n't running things then , the history of the world could have been completely different .
# butterflyeffect
bet sir winston would n't have allowed all the fiddlers to travel sir drury has even offered a few a lift home in the rolls
i bet he had the right arseache when he found out he was stopping at barking and west ham , to .
tall fellow was'nt he

documents.title: man without fully formed limbs completes sports challenge
text: a cambridge man born without fully formed limbs has completed a challenge to play all 34 olympic and paralympic sports .
john willis wants to encourage disabled and non-disabled people to play sport together .
during his challenge , which he finished by playing a round of golf in essex , he also managed to raise money for charity .
he 's now deciding which sports he 'll continue to play
author: Jonathan Park
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: lord willetts : university of essex is colchester 's biggest export
text: former conservative universities minister david - now lord - willetts has described the university of essex as `` colchester 's biggest export '' .
speaking at the party 's conference today , he told me student visas are one of the crucial issues for brexit negotiations if institutions like the university of essex are to be protected .
`` the tens of millions of pounds brought in by overseas students and spent locally at that university boost the local economy , '' he said .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: scooter rider dies after grays lorry crash
text: a man has died after his scooter hit a lorry in grays this afternoon , police say .
it happened in london road at about 12:15 .
a man in his 20s was pronounced dead at the scene .
the force say the road will remain closed for at least another hour .
motorists are advised to avoid london road in # grays near the stoneness roundabout following a fatal road collision .
road is closed

documents.title: 'essex boys ' murderer sues over jail assault
text: a murderer involved in the `` essex boys '' gangland killings is suing the ministry of justice for £ 100,000 after he was knocked unconscious in a jail assault .
michael steele ( jailed for life for killing three drug dealers in a range rover in rettendon in 1995 .
in 2010 , the 73-year-old was beaten with a steel pot in a kitchen after an argument over use of a telephone at maximum security hmp whitemoor , near march in cambridgeshire .
although he made a good recovery from the attack , steele is now suing the government for damages for failing to protect him .
the ministry of justice argued the claim had no chance of succeeding .
staff had no reason to suspect steele was at risk of an attack , lawyers said .
but after a central london county court hearing , judge avent said the claim would be allowed to go be heard in full before the courts .

documents.title: police search for cleaner known only as 'judy ' after jewellery disappears
text: police are searching for a cleaner after jewellery was stolen from a house in wivenhoe .
a necklace , watch and a three-figure sum of money was stolen from the home in caroline close sometime this month .
officers are looking for a woman called judy who had been working there as a cleaner .
she is white , aged 40 to 50 years old with straight brown hair , and , while police believe she lived locally , they do not know her surname .

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: here are the top stories we 've covered on essex live today :
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ex-boyfriend of towie star jailed
text: the former boyfriend of the only way is essex star gemma collins ( been jailed for two years for burglary .

st albans crown court heard homeless stephen mortimer , 35 , broke into a house in stockings lane , little berkhamsted , hertfordshire , on 22 may and stole £ 100 , days after he took jewellery from another home .
mortimer pleaded guilty to committing the burglary via a video link from chelmsford prison , where he is already serving a two year sentence for a burglary committed 11 days earlier .

his defence barrister , jay kallagher , told the court he was dating a reality tv star between february 2015 and april 2016 , was living in an expensive property and his daily actions were reported by the media .
when the relationship finished he moved to his mother 's property - a one bedroom flat in romford , east london - but ended up living on the streets .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mostly sunny this afternoon
text: fine and mostly sunny this afternoon with some patchy cloud later .
the winds will gradually strengthen with a rather cool south-easterly breeze developing .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
get your local forecast from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: brindley : colchester need to be more clinical in front of goal
text: colchester united defender richard brindley says the team needs to be more clinical in front of goal .
it 's four without a win for the u 's after saturday 's 2-0 loss at carlisle .
they had large spells of possession and pressure in the game and brindley says they need to make it count .
`` the goals that we let in - we 'll address that and put it right , '' he said .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: demetriou : southend united are improving
text: southend united defender jason demetriou says they team is improving , despite dropping back into league one 's bottom four on saturday .
the blues conceded in injury time of a 1-1 home draw with peterborough , but demetriou is confident they can climb the table .
`` we 've had a few good games , and hopefully we can build on it , '' he said .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: fa cup : braintree and billericay draw news
text: two essex sides have found out who stands between them and a place in the first round proper of the fa cup this morning .
braintree town have been drawn at home to fellow national league side bromley - while billericay play at maidstone united .
the ties are due to be played on saturday , 15 october .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: the meaning of brexit is very clear , says bernard jenkin mp
text: the conservative mp for harwich and north essex has told the bbc there should be an end to people saying `` we do n't know what brexit means '' .
yesterday , theresa may announced the government would trigger the formal process of leaving the european union before the end of march .
labour believes the timetable is meaningless unless proper plans are in place .

however , bernard jenkin said the way ahead was very clear : `` brexit means taking back control of your own laws , own money , own borders , and controlling these things like most other countries . ''

documents.title: sexual assault victim 'extremely distressed '
text: a woman who was sexually assaulted in chelmsford early this morning is being looked after by trained officers .

we would like to speak to anyone who may have found a cardboard pouch containing tobacco , a blue and silver lighter with a map of cyprus on it and a beige hair bobble anywhere between the city centre and the police station . ''

documents.title: woman sexually assaulted on walk home from night out
text: a woman has been sexually assaulted as she walked home from a night out in chelmsford , police say .
it happened in the early hours of this morning as she walked home alone from the city centre .
the victim was approached by a man wearing a hooded top who `` seriously sexually assaulted '' her in an alley way .

documents.title: rainbow graces the essex sky
text: i 'm the first to admit i 'm not professional photographer - but check out this perfectly formed rainbow i spotted while walking my dog in ashingdon .
it graced the sky on saturday afternoon at about 17:00 , following a sharp shower .
sadly there was no pot of gold at the end of it .
however , if you also spotted it , share it with us via email or twitter .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thwarted cash machine theft investigation continues
text: police are continuing to investigate the attempted theft of a cash machine in coggeshall early yesterday morning .

five men wearing balaclavas used a blue land rover , a silver jeep and chains to rip the cash machine from mccolls in church street , but fled the scene when they were interrupted by officers , the force say .
the men were described as white and aged in their 20s .

documents.title: nearly 3,000 essex motorists caught driving carelessly
text: nearly 3,000 motorists in essex have been fined for careless driving the the past 12 months , a freedom of information request by the times has found .
the offence includes things like eating at the wheel , taking photos of accidents and shaving or doing make up at the wheel .
police are allowed to issue fixed penalty notices for careless driving under powers introduced in 2013 .

documents.title: how to steer clear of a wedding dress disaster
text: how can you avoid a disaster before the biggest day of your life ?
wedding planner dominique douglas says it 's important to get references .
`` there are facebook forums you can go to and speak to other brides about their experiences , '' she said .
`` dresses can take time , but there are also shops out there that have stock which you can buy , if you fit the sizes . ''

documents.title: monday 's weather : plenty of autumnal sunshine
text: after a chilly start , with some patchy mist and fog in places , there 'll be plenty of autumnal sunshine and lots of blue skies .
top temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
it 'll be fairly clear overnight , but not quite so chilly , with lows of around 11c ( 52f ) .
get more on the forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: mother begs bust harlow wedding shop to let brides 'have their dreams '
text: a mum has made a plea to a harlow wedding dress shop which has gone bust , to let customers `` have their dreams '' .
d & q weddings in harvey centre went into liquidation last week .
it 's not clear if women who 've bought dresses will get their outfits or their money back .
sheila o'sullivan 's daughter charlie is due to get married next year : `` chances are she wo n't get a penny of what she 's paid back .
i 'm disgusted , i feel ripped off and i 'm terribly disappointed for my daughter . ''
essex has tried to contact the company but has not yet had a response .

documents.title: welcome to essex live
text: rise and shine essex , it 's time to start a new week here on essex live .
